# Welcome! {.unnumbered}

This course introduces postgraduate students to advanced statistical methods used in the quantitative social, educational, and behavioral sciences. Students will learn:

-   Data management.

-   Analysis of Variance (ANOVA) designs.

-   Simple and multiple linear regression. 

-   Simple and multiple logistic regression.

-   Factor Analysis.

-   Mediation and Path Analysis.

-   Meta-analysis.

The student will also learn about the principles of data visualization and statistical software JAMOVI.


 
 
 


**Sources for reading**

-   [Analysis of Variance Designs: A Conceptual and Computational Approach with SPSS and SAS](https://www.cambridge.org/highereducation/books/analysis-of-variance-designs/5500246DE031763B7D439A162FA97DF5#overview)
-   [Learning Statistics with Jamovi](https://davidfoxcroft.github.io/lsj-book/)
